clues: These are the gamusa that are used to give as a gift or felicitate

The name of the gifting ceremony at Bihu.
Gamusa is a usual gift given during this ceremony.
The name of the device at homes that is used for weaving.
This is a traditional garment worn over Mekhala Chador
A sweet dish made of raw rice flour, sugar and ghee
A sweet usually made during Bihu
The assamese name for Cane
The assamese name for Bamboo
The silk that is made of silk worms feed on mulberry silk
This is a type of Mekhela Chador usually made of bright green or red.
The name of the holy text which talks about Krishna
The name of the holy text written by Shankaradev.
The name of a guru who was the most popular spiritual guru

A prayer house where there is no idol worship.
Instead of an idol there is pyramid wrapped in gamusa. 
Chants are done by Bhokots
Mats made of bamboo are kept for Bhakts to sit.
Large percussion instruments which is used during chants in Nagar Naam
A story telling tradition where a particular story is recited along with people dancing
The percussion instrument which is played at Naam ghar

The name for people who do chants in Naam ghar, at weddings and death
They may not neccesarily be Brahmin but are almost always elderly.
The prasad made of sprouts, fruits, coconut, ginger, salt

The prasad given during Satya Narayan Katha.
It is made of milk and banana
A classical dance form from Assam
The name of the pillow made of cotton where the cotton seeds are not removed.
The name given to the best man in an Assamese wedding.
The garment worn by the groom at the wedding

The ritual done to wade of evil eye.
It is done at any auspicious event.

ground_truth: xoru biya or xanti biya or tuluni biha
clues:
The coming of age ceremony for girls.
The is done after 7 days of the girl's periods.
Prior to this ceremony girl eats non-spicy food like boiled rice on banana leaf. 
In some places girls marry a banana tree

This is the harvest festival.
Feasting is the primary form of celebration.

This is the sowing festival.
Celebrated in the month of Spring.
Dancing is the primary way of celebration

This occurs in October when people pray for good harvest.
The most minimalist Bihu.

A dish made on special occassions like Magh Bighu.
Sticky gelatinous rice is made into a powder and then made into a flatbread in a hot pan.
Coconut or til filling.
The inside of Banana stem.
It is a salty fiddlehead fern, this is foraged and not cultivated.
A food made of Amroli ant larvae that is had during Bihu

A citrousy fruit commonly used to make fish curry.
The seed of this fruit is used for hair conditioning.
The rice wine made by the Dimasa Tribe
Rice wine made in Assam

One day before Bihu, the cow is worshiped.
A garland made of vegetables is put around the cow and the next morning people take a bath.
A mix of haldi and Maah is put before taking a bath.

Roasted rice powder. 
It is usually mixed with milk tea
The ceremony before wedding where the groom's mother and exchanges gifts with the bride in a Xorai
the traditional dance of the Boro people
The most common dance done by the tea cultivators
The traditional dress worn by Boro people
Gamusa like cloth wrapped around the waist for men.
The recitation of Kirtan Goha
The structure of Bamboo that is burnt on the morning of Magh Bihu.
The night before Magh Bihu
The festival that celebrates the coming of age for Brahmin boys.
The quick fix and simple pitha made at home.
A holi like festival in Assam.
The day when non-veg is reintroduced into the family after a death
The wedding tradition of Ahoms
The wedding tradition where fire is lit and fluffed rice is put in it.
A popular snack and is offered to the fire God when Bhela Ghar is burnt.
The dish made of sticky rice consumed with milk
A festival celebrating Krishna
The mela held in June or july to celebrate the menstrual cycle of goddess Kamakhya.
